body:
Comment 7 by **MarkHkamp**: 
I have modified $GOROOT/src/cmd/godoc/godoc.go to add an "indexdelay" flag to godoc. It
specifies how many seconds to wait before indexing. If set to 0, indexing is disabled
entirely, along with search. It defaults to 60 seconds, so existing godoc invocation is
unchanged.

The diff is attached. I'm also working through the steps at
http://golang.org/doc/contribute.html, though from a different email address. Hopefully
this patch is an acceptable way to keep things working as intended while allowing users
the choice to disable memory-hungry search if they wish.
Attachments: 1. godoc.diff (713 bytes)
